fr.apteryx.imageio.dicom
Class StorageSCP

Object
  StorageSCP

public class StorageSCP
extends Object

Implements a Storage SCP for receiving images through the network.

If a listener is specified in a constructor, the listener method is called when an object is received, within an association thread. If no listener is specified, the user must call receiveObject, which blocks until a object is received on any one association.

Calling receiveObject when a listener was specified in a constructor may lead to unexpected results.

The constructors accept two listener interfaces: StorageSCPListener is the simplest one. ReceivedObjectListener allows more control on the response is sent back to the Storage SCU.

When implementing a simple Storage SCP which just receives instances and write them down to disk without processing them, it is usually advised to call setRawValues to ensure the data are written back without alteration and to minimize the computational ressources needed.

StorageSCP

public StorageSCP(int port,
                  InetAddress addr,
                  SecureTransport st)
Creates a Storage SCP that will listen for requests on the specified port when start() is called. Transport will be insecure if st is null. The SCP will listen to all local addresses if addr is null. Objects received by a SCP created using this constructor must be read using a DicomReader whose input is set to this SCP.

StorageSCP

public StorageSCP(int port,
                  InetAddress addr,
                  SecureTransport st,
                  StorageSCPListener listener)
Creates a Storage SCP that will listen for requests on the specified port when start() is called. The objectReceived method of the specified StorageSCPListener will be called when an object is received. The received objects must be read using a DicomReader whose input is set to the ReceivedObject. A response is sent to the Storage SCU after objectReceived returns with a "success" or "warning" status code depending whether warning happened when receiving the object. Transport will be insecure if st is null. The SCP will listen to all local addresses if addr is null.

StorageSCP

public StorageSCP(int port,
                  InetAddress addr,
                  SecureTransport st,
                  ReceivedObjectListener listener)
Creates a Storage SCP that will listen for requests on the specified port when start() is called. The objectReceived method of the specified ReceivedObjectListener will be called when an object is received. The received objects must be read using a DicomReader whose input is set to the ReceivedObject. The objectReceived method has the option to modify the response before it is sent to the Storage SCU. Transport will be insecure if st is null. The SCP will listen to all local addresses if addr is null.

Method Detail

start

public void start()
           throws IOException
Binds the TCP server if it has not already been done and starts to listen for requests.

Called automatically by DicomReader when this StorageSCP is used as its input.

Throws:
IOException

stop

public void stop()
          throws IOException
Stops answering to requests.

Throws:
IOException

setRawValues

public void setRawValues(RawValues rv)
Determines if the attribute values in received objects are kept raw or not.

If set to RawValues.ALL, attribute values of data elements are not decoded. Values can only be read using DicomMetadata.getAttribute(int) and are always returned as byte[], except for sequences that are returned as a Vector of DataSets, and pixel data that are returned as instances of a private class.

If set to RawValues.PIXELDATA, only the value of the PixelData attribute is kept raw. This setting is handy when metadata needs to be processed but pixel data does not need or cannot be extracted.

If set to RawValues.NONE (the default), all attributes are decoded and pixel data can be read as images.

setRawMode

public void setRawMode(boolean b)
Deprecated. Use setRawValues(fr.apteryx.imageio.dicom.RawValues) instead.

receiveObject

public ReceivedObject receiveObject()
                             throws InterruptedException
Called by DicomReader when input is set to a StorageSCP. May also be called directly by user. The returned ReceivedObject may be set as an input of a DicomReader.

Throws:
InterruptedException

setPreferredTransferSyntaxes

public void setPreferredTransferSyntaxes(String[] ts)
                                  throws DicomException
Sets the preferred transfer syntaxes used when negotiating during association establishment. Transfer syntaxes are specified by an array of UID strings, in decreasing order of preference.

An exception is thrown if one of the syntax is not supported for input.

By default, the array of preferred transfer syntaxes contains all the transfer syntaxes supported for input, starting with the always-supported, lossless, transfer syntax : UID.RLECompressionTS, UID.ExplicitBigEndianTS, UID.ExplicitLittleEndianTS, UID.ImplicitLittleEndianTS.

If null is specified, the default array is restored.

This method must be called before the SCP is started.

Throws:
DicomException

setAcceptedSOPClasses

public void setAcceptedSOPClasses(String[] sc)
Sets the SOP classes this SCP will accept to receive. By default, the accepted classes are all composite image storage classes, plus the PDF Encapsulated and Hanging Protocol Storage Classes.

If null is specified, the default accepted classes are restored.

See Also:
setAcceptAllSOPClasses()

setAcceptAllSOPClasses

public void setAcceptAllSOPClasses()
Let this server accept all SOP classes he receives storage request for. By default, the accepted classes are all composite image storage classes, plus the PDF Encapsulated and Hanging Protocol Storage classes.

See Also:
setAcceptedSOPClasses(java.lang.String[])

setApplicationTitles

public void setApplicationTitles(String[] calling,
                                 String[] called)
This class will only handle messages from associations using calling and called Application Entitities (AE) titles listed in the specified arrays. Passing a null array means that any AE will be accepted. By default, every called and calling AE are accepted. This method must be called before the service is started.

setApplicationTitles

public void setApplicationTitles(String calling,
                                 String called)
Convenient replacement for setApplicationTitles(String[], String[]) when using single titles. Passing a null String meants that any AE will be accepted.
